results.title: Foreign correspondent
results.creator_credit: Walter Wanger, Walter Wanger Pictures, Inc. and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: This entertaining espionage thriller with a strong supporting cast was one of several made at the time to warn the American public against an isolationist stance towards the events in Europe. It is constructed as a series of climactic set pieces, linked by a play upon the deceptiveness of appearances and the cyclic journey of a couple searching for Nazi spies in London and Holland following the disappearance of a diplomat - a journey which establishes the reporter-hero’s identity. It bears a close relationship to other picaresque thrillers directed by Hitchcock: “The 39 Steps”, “Saboteur” and “North By Northwest”. Cast includes Joel McCrea, Laraine Day, Herbert Marshall and George Sanders.

results.title: Ford Australia: 75 years
results.creator_credit: Richard Cornish and Q Media Productions
results.brief_description: Geelong, July 1st 1925 and Australia’s first model T Ford rolled off a temporary production line. In the year 2000 the Ford Motor Company celebrated 75 years of continuous production in Australia. This video explores the Model T, the world’s first ute designed and built in Geelong, Fordson Tractors, the Customline, Ford GTs and many more through to the current model Ford AUII.

results.title: Forces: composition and resolution
results.brief_description: Defines forces as vector qualities and illustrates how components and resultants may be determined graphically. Shows the methods for finding both resultants and components in problems involving two or more forces acting at angles. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Forces make forms
results.creator_credit: Kinex productions, FilmFair Communications, Harry Robin and Peter Wright
results.brief_description: Unusual and everyday objects and events are used to encourage critical observation and logical association between forces in operation and their resultant forms. Examples of both natural and man-made forces and the forms they create are designed to assist students to become aware of their visual environment. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Forces
results.creator_credit: Tarquin Cardona, Bob Starner, Olga Palacio, First Light Pictures and Schlessinger Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physical science in action”.
There are many forces at work shaping our world every moment of our lives. This video describes Newton’s laws (first, second and third), friction, gravity, air and water pressure, and electromagnetism. Also explored is the concept of unbalanced forces. Suitable for Upper primary/lower secondary students. Teachers notes included.

results.title: Forces
results.creator_credit: Stephen White, Norton Bloom, Physical Sciences Study Committee and Educational Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Introduces the principles of mechanics by showing the Cavendish experiment which illustrates the gravitational forces between small objects. Also compares gravitational force with magnetic force. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Force of the wind
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Justin Somerville and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Justin Somerville never thought he would be in the middle of a tornado, so his first reaction was that he wanted to witness this phenomena. His account of the aftermath provides detail well beyond the media coverage of the devestation of this small town.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: Force of evil
results.creator_credit: Bob Roberts, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Enterprise Studios and Abraham Polonsky
results.brief_description: John Garfield gives one of his most outstanding performances as the successful Wall Street lawyer Joe Morse who has made his considerable fortune out of petty corruption and looking after the interests of the gambling underworld. When big-time racketeer Ben Tucker (Roy Roberts) gets Joe to assist him in controlling the New York numbers game, Joe has to put the career and life of his own brother, Leo (Thomas Gomez), in jeopardy. This forces Joe into having to decide between the seduction of big money and loyalty to his brother. From this minimalist film-noir plot, Polonsky has fashioned a dark fable about the American Dream. Notable also for being one of the first Hollywood films to use location street shots, the imposing skyscrapers and the depressing tenement slums of New York City add layers of visual meaning to the film, further drawing connections between good and evil, morality and criminality, poverty and wealth. Polonsky’s and Garfield’s careers were to be destroyed by the McCarthy political witch-hunts, particularly when they refused to betray their friends in the show-trials for the House of Un-American Activities. “Force of Evil”, and it’s critical examination of wealth and power in urban America was used as evidence of their Communist leanings. The film is based on the novel “Tucker’s People” by Ira Wolfert.

results.title: Force & motion: Newton's 3 Laws
results.creator_credit: P. David Langley and Barr Films
results.brief_description: Using experiments and laboratory demonstrations, this basic physics film clearly explains Newton’s three fundamental laws of force and motion: the velocity of an object remains constant unless a force acts upon the object; Force=Mass * Acceleration; and to every action there is an equal and opposite reaction.

results.title: Forbidden planet
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Nayfack, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Fred Wilcox
results.brief_description: The year is 2257AD and the distant planet Altair-IV has three lone inhabitants: Professor Morbius (Walter Pidgeon), a fugitive super-scientist who has created a world of futuristic marvels; his daughter Altaira (Ann Francis), a bewitching innocent who has lived her entire life on the planet: and their servant, Robby the Robot. Then Commander Adams (Leslie Nielsen) arrives, and what ensues is a spine-chilling adventure with a hint of romance. “Forbidden planet” became a cult classic.
